DOC.brief_title: The Impact Texas Senate Bill 42 Middle School Children 's Level Physical Activity
DOC.detailed_description: Childhood overweight significant public health issue Texas . In response problem , 79th Texas legislature pass Senate Bill 42 ( SB 42 ) , promote healthy school environment middle school , June , 2005 . As result SB 42 , Texas public middle school must require student engage least 30 minute daily physical activity total 135 minute physical activity per week , begin 2006-2007 school year . The purpose study determine barrier facilitator implementation ultimate impact mandate school PE , child physical activity , child overweight Texas public middle school , specifically among child live Lower Rio Grande Valley ( LRGV ) South Texas . Questionnaires key informant ( school principal , PE teacher , school district PE health education director ) conduct random sample middle school assess implementation SB 42 ( 2006-2007 ) . In addition , detailed evaluation SB 42 accomplish representative sample middle school LRGV , low-income Latino area state . Measurements LRGV school include observed measure child physical activity , self-reported physical activity behavior , child overweight ( BMI ) .
